metadata.synopsis: Short dialog if player tries to approach Viconia without Shadowheart nearby. Viconia seeks to acquire the Astral Prism (the artefact SH once guarded) but that is impossible. Instead, Viconia demands the player demand SH to her for punishment, or else she and her followers will attack.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to the grotto without Shadowheart2. Talk to Viconia

35.speaker: Viconia DeVir
35.text: You and I need to speak...
35.context: NodeContext: Cautioning - referring to how the player attacked an illusion of her earlier.

32.speaker: Viconia DeVir
32.text: Unless, of course, you are intent on attacking me again? I would not advise it.
32.context: NodeContext: Cautioning - referring to how the player attacked an illusion of her earlier.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You've finally found yourself a following, Mother Superior. And you only had to hollow out their heads to do it.
26.context: NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

104.speaker: Player
104.text: You've finally found yourself a following, Mother Superior. And you only had to hollow out their heads to do it.
104.context: NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

42.speaker: Jaheira
42.text: You've finally found yourself a following, Mother Superior. And you only had to hollow out their heads to do it.
42.context: NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

140.speaker: Minsc
140.text: Pin your eyes to the treacherous she-drow. Do not focus on the many, many others - Boo will handle them.
140.context: NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

114.speaker: Viconia DeVir
114.text: Always a pleasure to see old acquaintances. But you would be wise to not interfere in this matter.
114.context: NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

24.speaker: Player
24.text: We already spoke - while you tried to poke about in my thoughts.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: We already spoke - while you tried to poke about in my thoughts.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: We already spoke - while you tried to poke about in my thoughts.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: We already spoke - if you can call that 'Mapping' farce a conversation.

88.speaker: Viconia DeVir
88.text: A necessary ruse - one that allowed me to seek out your true intentions. The House of Grief attracts all manner of people, but only some have value to Lady Shar.

63.speaker: Viconia DeVir
63.text: You have value. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: It's called an Astral Prism. And let me guess - you want it. An old song, take my word for it.
87.context: NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

102.speaker: Viconia DeVir
102.text: Its name does not concern me. Its power does. I have been awaiting word of this item for some time, ever since I dispatched a cadre of Lady Shar's children to retrieve it. I have been very patient, but no more.
102.context: NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

0.speaker: Viconia DeVir
0.text: I felt Shadowheart's presence in your mind, and with it, the artefact. She succeeded in retrieving it, but then it is you who appeared, not her. Where is the artefact?
0.context: NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Why do you even want it?
95.context: NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

129.speaker: Viconia DeVir
129.text: I did not consent to questions. But I suppose you have undergone a great deal to reach this place, and anything I tell you cannot compromise me now - for you will either leave on my terms, or not at all...
129.context: NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

43.speaker: Viconia DeVir
43.text: Whispers reached my ears from all corners - potential rivals of Lady Shar, all vying for the same prize. A new god, amassing the disaffected, the outcasts - those who should turn to us.
43.context: NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

69.speaker: Viconia DeVir
69.text: This 'Absolute' is but an upstart; disturbing the natural order and threatening to impede the glorious return of Lady Shar's pure, endless darkness.

77.speaker: Viconia DeVir
77.text: I had to act. I had to strangle that foul conspiracy while it was still in the cradle.

21.speaker: Viconia DeVir
21.text: We learned all we could - the artefact was the one thing the Absolutists feared. The one thing they desperately wanted to keep out of their enemies' grasp. I had to have it.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Shar bid you to do all of this?
76.context: NodeContext: Hint of tension between her and her goddess. Their goals aren't aligned

58.speaker: Viconia DeVir
58.text: Lady Shar's concerns lie elsewhere - with another. But she is a goddess... she can afford to ignore that which does not threaten her.
58.context: NodeContext: Hint of tension between her and her goddess. Their goals aren't aligned

155.speaker: Viconia DeVir
155.text: I must keep her faith alive in mortal hearts. I must defend her ways, lead her children, stop all threats. Even if I must go against her wishes, I will prove myself her most loyal servant.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: You thought you could best the Absolute? The githyanki?

50.speaker: Viconia DeVir
50.text: To fight so many foes openly could prove unwise. Shar's children are better deployed as daggers in the shadows, not massed upon a battlefield.

49.speaker: Viconia DeVir
49.text: So let the others fight, while we wait. Once they are spent and bloodied from each other, we would slip in and take the prize. Alas, most of those I sent, perished. All but one - Shadowheart.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Viconia trails off, holding your gaze with a dark, hungry look. She has staked everything on acquiring the Astral Prism.*

153.speaker: Viconia DeVir
153.text: Then answer me - where is the artefact?

37.speaker: Player
37.text: The Astral Prism is with me. And it's staying with me.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

23.speaker: Viconia DeVir
23.text: A bold claim given your current circumstances. I have not assembled my forces here just to spectate.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Somehow I'm not sure I should tell you.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

22.speaker: Viconia DeVir
22.text: Then this will be a very short conversation. I have not assembled my forces here just to spectate.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Long gone. That thing was more trouble than it was worth.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

7.speaker: Viconia DeVir
7.text: No, I think not. The artefact occupies you greatly, I felt it. Most curiously as well - like you hate it and need it. Millstone and life preserver.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

70.speaker: Viconia DeVir
70.text: Humour me with a little negotiation. Perhaps we can find terms that will allow blades to remain sheathed.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

147.speaker: Player
147.text: All right, you wish to negotiate? Make me an offer then.
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

16.speaker: Viconia DeVir
16.text: How about the artefact for your life? And perhaps even my support in the battles yet to come, against the Absolute?
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

148.speaker: Player
148.text: This must be truly important, if Shar would allow you to make such an offer. Why do you want it?
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Shar will allow you to make such an offer?
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

115.speaker: Viconia DeVir
115.text: My Lady ... she does not heed this new threat. This Absolute.
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

30.speaker: Viconia DeVir
30.text: Perhaps she is above such mortal concerns, but I must preserve her church, even if she does not ask me to.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

14.speaker: Viconia DeVir
14.text: When I deal with the Absolute, my standing with Lady Shar will be stronger than ever. My rightful place is at her right hand, and I will remain there.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

89.speaker: Viconia DeVir
89.text: I will not be replaced by Shadow...
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

62.speaker: Player
62.text: *You suddenly realise what has been troubling her. Shar has rewarded her loyalty by forcing her to groom her own replacement - Shadowheart.*
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

60.text: *You suddenly realise what has been troubling her. Shar has rewarded her loyalty by forcing her to groom her own replacement - Shadowheart.*
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *You suddenly realise what has been troubling her. Shar has rewarded her loyalty by forcing her to groom her own replacement - Shadowheart.*
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I can't give you the artefact. But I can give you Shadowheart.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

124.speaker: Viconia DeVir
124.text: I shall find her in due time. Perhaps I'll disguise myself, and ask your corpse where she's hiding.
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

46.text: I shall find her in due time. Perhaps I'll disguise myself, and ask your corpse where she's hiding.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

59.speaker: Viconia DeVir
59.text: I shall find her in due time. Perhaps I'll disguise myself, and ask your corpse where she's hiding.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

126.speaker: Viconia DeVir
126.context: CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attackNodeContext: l-ill allure

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Not happening. Even if I wanted to give it to you, I can't. The artefact is bound to me. It will kill you.
78.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

74.speaker: Viconia DeVir
74.text: My interest is defeating the Absolute. It seems you're on that path already. I will not have it said that I am unreasonable.
74.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

90.speaker: Viconia DeVir
90.text: My interest is defeating the Absolute. It seems you're on that path already. I will not have it said that I am unreasonable.
90.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

15.speaker: Viconia DeVir
15.text: Shadowheart. Surrender her to me - she has much to answer for.
15.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Let me go, and I'll bring her to you.
25.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Tsk'va. You would trade out a proven ally for the empty promises of Shar's despotic disciple?
53.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

66.speaker: Lae'zel
66.text: Tsk'va. You would trade out a proven ally for the empty promises of Shar's despotic disciple?
66.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

1.speaker: Jaheira
1.text: I imagine she will have something to say about the matter. If we must return, let it be with blades bared.
1.context: NodeContext: Snort of contempt for Viconia, and for us if we plan on giving Shadowheart to her.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Go, fetch her. And should you not stay true to your word... well...

45.speaker: Viconia DeVir
45.text: Go, fetch her. And should you not stay true to your word... well...

38.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
38.text: The child Shadowheart can be irritating and naive, but what do you hope to gain by handing her to DeVir?
38.context: NodeContext: Aside, to the player, after the player has said to an enemy that they will betray Shadowheart.

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: This better be a long con, soldier.
57.context: NodeContext: Aside, to the player, after the player has said to an enemy that they will betray Shadowheart.

86.speaker: Wyll
86.text: You are truly out of your mind, to even consider the notion. Shadowheart is our ally - our friend.

106.speaker: Gale
106.text: Shadowheart is one of us. Betray her, and you betray us all.

116.speaker: Astarion
116.text: Sure, fine - whatever we have to say to escape this woman.

137.speaker: Minsc
137.text: We will? My friend, has it escaped your notice that Viconia is not good...?

143.speaker: Halsin
143.text: A ruse, surely? You cannot actually intend to betray Shadowheart, after all you have been through... can you?

52.speaker: Player
52.text: What will you do to her?
52.context: NodeContext: Contempt for Viconia and whatever lessons she proposes to teach.

121.speaker: Viconia DeVir
121.text: She will be reeducated. Lady Shar may still have use for her - under my control.
121.context: NodeContext: Contempt for Viconia and whatever lessons she proposes to teach.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Reeducation. Viconia would feed Shadowheart a doctrine of lies before she could see the plain truth.
31.context: NodeContext: Contempt for Viconia and whatever lessons she proposes to teach.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Reeducation. Viconia would feed Shadowheart a doctrine of lies before she could see the plain truth.
67.context: NodeContext: Contempt for Viconia and whatever lessons she proposes to teach.

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: What can a worm teach others but how to crawl? Shadowheart has no need of your 'instruction', Viconia.
9.context: NodeContext: Contempt for Viconia and whatever lessons she proposes to teach.

29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
29.text: These Sharrans erase the personality of all those who threaten them. Just another miserable cult.
29.context: NodeContext: To the player, after a bad guy has said SH will be 'reeducated' if brought to the Sharran cloister. Foreboding, not willing to give up SH.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: I think we both know exactly what she means by that. Our girl would be gone.
64.context: NodeContext: To the player, after a bad guy has said SH will be 'reeducated' if brought to the Sharran cloister. Foreboding, not willing to give up SH.

93.speaker: Wyll
93.text: 'Reeducation?' Forced indoctrination, more like - her memories cleansed, her mind a clean parchment for Viconia to write on.
93.context: NodeContext: Astarion's not impressed, given his own history

107.speaker: Gale
107.text: Do not insult our intelligence. You'd erase her, make a blank vellum of her mind, her memories, and inscribe it with your poison.
107.context: NodeContext: Astarion's not impressed, given his own history

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: 'Reeducation' sounds an awful lot like enslavement to me.
110.context: NodeContext: Astarion's not impressed, given his own history

125.speaker: Minsc
125.text: Shadowheart has no need for any of Viconia's educating. She is sinister enough by herself - and our ally all the same.
125.context: NodeContext: grim. imagining what torments will await a companion if betrayed

139.speaker: Halsin
139.text: Reeducation. As if this sect has not mangled poor Shadowheart's mind enough already.
139.context: NodeContext: grim. imagining what torments will await a companion if betrayed

105.speaker: Viconia DeVir
105.text: Oh, but I shall. I'll just ask your corpse where she's hiding.

113.speaker: Viconia DeVir
113.text: She was mine to deal with - you robbed me of that.

65.speaker: Viconia DeVir
65.text: I suppose dealing with you will have to suffice.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Killing me will achieve nothing. There's a greater threat to face together - the Absolute.

134.text: Perhaps... perhaps I am being ungrateful. You spared me having to look upon that whelp Shadowheart's face again.

2.speaker: Viconia DeVir
2.text: Perhaps... perhaps I am being ungrateful. You spared me having to look upon that whelp Shadowheart's face again.

133.speaker: Viconia DeVir
133.text: Very well. You may go freely, and count upon Lady Shar's warriors when the final battle is met.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: The artefact alone can't save you. Best if we unite against our common enemy - the Absolute.

12.speaker: Viconia DeVir
12.text: The Absolute shall be dealt with in time. You shall be dealt with right now.

34.text: The Absolute shall be dealt with in time. You shall be dealt with right now.

103.speaker: Viconia DeVir
103.text: The Absolute shall be dealt with in time. You shall be dealt with right now.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: As far as the artefact is concerned, there's nothing to discuss.

130.speaker: Viconia DeVir
130.text: Reconsider. Aid me, and you can count on my support against the Absolute. Reject me, and your journey ends here.

123.speaker: Viconia DeVir
123.text: Too late to keep your counsel, I'm afraid. You already revealed so much to me during the Mapping.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

154.speaker: Viconia DeVir
154.text: Oh but I think you do - the Mapping unearthed much more than your heartform - I saw all your secrets.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I know I have value to my patron - but what you see in me I've no idea.

85.speaker: Viconia DeVir
85.text: Please, do you truly think that is an option?

84.speaker: Player
84.text: With such an audience? A trap, if I ever saw one.

83.speaker: Viconia DeVir
83.text: A trap? Perhaps. But not all traps need to be sprung. Sometimes it's wiser to await an even greater prey.

4.speaker: Viconia DeVir
4.text: Welcome to the true heart of the House of Grief. For what is grief but a facet of loss? And what is loss but the very nature of my Lady Shar's power?

55.speaker: Viconia DeVir
55.text: I saw in your mind, when we spoke above. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.

40.speaker: Viconia DeVir
40.text: Remember our agreement - deliver Shadowheart to me, and you can count upon Lady Shar's warriors at your side, when the time comes.

152.speaker: Viconia DeVir
152.text: You may have evaded the Mapping of the Heart, but never mind - I can delve into your true intentions right now...

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *You feel the barest of presences caress your mind - she's reading your thoughts.*

47.speaker: Viconia DeVir
47.text: Ah, as I thought. Quite an adventure has brought you to this point - illithids, kidnapping, infection, the Hells, hunted by cultists and githyanki alike... and of course, the artefact.

142.speaker: Viconia DeVir
142.text: Linger if you wish, but there is little else to be said until the Absolute's armies launch their final assault. We shall be ready.
